df-relexp
blocks.content: Definition of repeated composition of a relation with itself, aka relation exponentiation. (Contributed by Drahflow, 12-Nov-2015.) (Revised by RP, 22-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-relexp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(crelexp, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cn0, cif(cres(cid, cun(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cfv(cseq(nat1, cmpo(s2, s3, universe, universe, ccom(cv(s2), cv(s0))), cmpt(s4, universe, cv(s0))), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s1), nat0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-relexp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ⊢ ^r =(s0 ∈ 𝕌, s1 ∈ ℕ0 ↦ if(s1 = 0,(= |`(dom(s0)⋃ ran(s0))),(seq(1((s2 ∈ 𝕌, s3 ∈ 𝕌 ↦(s2 ∘ s0)),(s4 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ s0)))` s1)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
}

thm relexpnndm(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ dom((c1[^r]c0))⊆ dom(c1))
} = {
  imp(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]c0))⊆ dom(c1))
  nnind(hs0, hs1, c0, (c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r]c0))⊆ dom(c1)), (c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r]hs0))⊆ dom(c1)), (c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r]1))⊆ dom(c1)), (c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r]hs1))⊆ dom(c1)), (c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1)))⊆ dom(c1)))
  imbi2d(hs0 = 1, c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]hs0))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]1))⊆ dom(c1))
  sseq1d(dom((c1[^r]hs0)), dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]1)), hs0 = 1)
  dmeqd((c1[^r]hs0), (c1[^r]1), hs0 = 1)
  oveq2(hs0, nat1, c1, crelexp)
  imbi2d(hs0 = hs1, c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]hs0))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]hs1))⊆ dom(c1))
  sseq1d(dom((c1[^r]hs0)), dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]hs1)), hs0 = hs1)
  dmeqd((c1[^r]hs0), (c1[^r]hs1), hs0 = hs1)
  oveq2(hs0, hs1, c1, crelexp)
  imbi2d(hs0 =(hs1[+]1), c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]hs0))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1)))⊆ dom(c1))
  sseq1d(dom((c1[^r]hs0)), dom(c1), dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1))), hs0 =(hs1[+]1))
  dmeqd((c1[^r]hs0), (c1[^r](hs1[+]1)), hs0 =(hs1[+]1))
  oveq2(hs0, (hs1[+]1), c1, crelexp)
  imbi2d(hs0 = c0, c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]hs0))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]c0))⊆ dom(c1))
  sseq1d(dom((c1[^r]hs0)), dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]c0)), hs0 = c0)
  dmeqd((c1[^r]hs0), (c1[^r]c0), hs0 = c0)
  oveq2(hs0, c0, c1, crelexp)
  syl(c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]1))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r]1))= dom(c1))
  dmeqd((c1[^r]1), c1, c1 ∈ c2)
  relexp1g(c1, c2)
  eqimss(dom((c1[^r]1)), dom(c1))
  a2d(hs1 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ c2, dom((c1[^r]hs1))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1)))⊆ dom(c1))
  ex(hs1 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ c2, (dom((c1[^r]hs1))⊆ dom(c1)→ dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1)))⊆ dom(c1)))
  a1d((hs1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ c2), dom((c1[^r]hs1))⊆ dom(c1), dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1)))⊆ dom(c1))
  syl6eqss(dom((c1[^r](hs1[+]1))), dom(c1), dom(((c1[^r]hs1)∘ c1)), (hs1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ c2))
  dmeqd((c1[^r](hs1[+]1)), ((c1[^r]hs1)∘ c1), (hs1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ c2))
  ancoms(hs1 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ c2, (c1[^r](hs1[+]1))=((c1[^r]hs1)∘ c1))
  relexpsucnnr(c1, c2, hs1)
  dmcoss((c1[^r]hs1), c1)

  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r]c0))⊆ dom(c1)))
  diff.hs0.w((c1 ∈ c2 → dom((c1[^r]1))⊆ dom(c1)))

  syl(wa(wceq(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, c2)), wss(cdm(co(c1, crelexp, c0)), cun(cdm(c1), crn(c1))), wceq(cdm(co(c1, crelexp, c0)), cun(cdm(c1), crn(c1))))
  syl6eq(cdm(co(c1, crelexp, c0)), cun(cdm(c1), crn(c1)), cdm(cres(cid, cun(cdm(c1), crn(c1)))), wa(wceq(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, c2)))

blocks.name: relexpuzrel
blocks.content: The exponentiation of a class to an integer not smaller than 2 is a relation. (Contributed by RP, 23-May-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm relexpuzrel(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  eluzge2nn0(c0)
  simpr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, c2))
  pm2.21d(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(c0, nat1), wrel(c1))
  neneqd(c0, nat1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, c2)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, c2), wne(c0, nat1))
  simprbi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wne(c0, nat1), wcel(c0, cn))

}
blocks.pretty:
thm relexpuzrel(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ Rel((c1[^r]c0)))
} = {
  syl3anc((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)∧ c1 ∈ c2), Rel((c1[^r]c0)), c0 ∈ ℕ0, c1 ∈ c2, (c0 = 1 → Rel(c1)))
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2), c1 ∈ c2, c0 ∈ ℕ0)
  eluzge2nn0(c0)
  simpr(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2), c1 ∈ c2)
  pm2.21d((c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)∧ c1 ∈ c2), c0 = 1, Rel(c1))
  neneqd(c0, nat1, (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2)∧ c1 ∈ c2))
  adantr(c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2), c1 ∈ c2, c0 ≠ 1)

  eluz2b3(c0)

}
